comments.body: There is a discussion about conda provided man pages [here](https://github.com/conda/conda/issues/845). I think you're doing the "right" thing already.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@    # in the next release: https://github.com/hoytech/vmtouch/pull/71
    # Here we'll just include the fix manually.
    - mkdir -p $PREFIX/bin $PREFIX/share/man/man8
    - install -m 0755 vmtouch $PREFIX/bin/vmtouch
    - install -m 0644 vmtouch.8 $PREFIX/share/man/man8/vmtouch.8

comments.body:
You could use selectors to conditionally run `make install` here:
```suggestion
    - make
    - make install  # [not osx]
```
The macOS specific lines below can then be appended with `  # [osx]`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@  number: 0
  script:
    - make
    # "make install" is broken on Mac OS in version 1.3.1, but should be fixed
    # in the next release: https://github.com/hoytech/vmtouch/pull/71
